Package com.dua3.utility.crypt

Class KeyUtil

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.crypt.KeyUtil
public final class KeyUtil extends Object
Utility class for cryptographic key operations.

      Generate random salt for key derivation.
      Parameters:
      length - salt length in bytes (recommended: 16 or 32)
      Returns:
      random salt

    • validateSymmetricKey

      public static void validateSymmetricKey(Key key, SymmetricAlgorithm algorithm) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Validates a symmetric key for use with the specified algorithm.
      Parameters:
      key - the key to validate
      algorithm - the algorithm the key will be used with
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if the key is not compatible or key validation fails

    • toSecretKey

      public static SecretKey toSecretKey(byte[] keyBytes) throws InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
      Create a SecretKey from a byte array using the default algorithm.
      Parameters:
      keyBytes - the key bytes (must be 128, 192, or 256 bits for AES)
      Returns:
      SecretKey instance
      Throws:
      InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if the bytes could not be converted to a secret key

    • toSecretKey

      public static SecretKey toSecretKey(byte[] keyBytes, SymmetricAlgorithm algorithm) throws InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
      Converts the provided byte array into a SecretKey using the specified symmetric algorithm.
      Parameters:
      keyBytes - the byte array representing the key material
      algorithm - the symmetric algorithm used to validate the key size and determine the key algorithm
      Returns:
      a SecretKey generated from the provided key material and algorithm
      Throws:
      InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if the key size is invalid for the specified algorithm

      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if key generation fails

    • toKeyPair

      public static KeyPair toKeyPair(byte[] publicKeyBytes, byte[] privateKeyBytes, AsymmetricAlgorithm algorithm) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Creates a KeyPair using the given public and private key byte arrays.
      Parameters:
      publicKeyBytes - the byte array representation of the public key
      privateKeyBytes - the byte array representation of the private key
      algorithm - the asymmetric algorithm
      Returns:
      a KeyPair consisting of the public and private keys
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if the key conversion fails

    • generateECKeyPair

      public static KeyPair generateECKeyPair(String curveName) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Generate an Elliptic Curve key pair using a named curve.

      Supported standard curves:

      • "secp256r1" (P-256) - 256-bit curve
      • "secp384r1" (P-384) - 384-bit curve
      • "secp521r1" (P-521) - 521-bit curve
      Parameters:
      curveName - the name of the elliptic curve ("secp256r1", "secp384r1", "secp521r1")
      Returns:
      the generated EC key pair
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if key generation fails or the curve is not supported

    • generateRSAKeyPair

      public static KeyPair generateRSAKeyPair() throws InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
      Generate an RSA key pair with default key size (2048 bits).
      Returns:
      the generated RSA key pair
      Throws:
      InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if the key generation fails

    • generateKeyPair

      public static KeyPair generateKeyPair(AsymmetricAlgorithm algorithm, int keySize) throws InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
      Generate an asymmetric key pair.
      Parameters:
      algorithm - the asymmetric algorithm
      keySize - the key size in bits
      Returns:
      the generated key pair
      Throws:
      InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if key size validation fails or key generation fails

    • validateAsymmetricKeySize

      public static void validateAsymmetricKeySize(AsymmetricAlgorithm algorithm, int keySize) throws InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
      Validates the size of an asymmetric key based on the specified algorithm. Ensures that the key size meets the minimum or required standards for security purposes.
      Parameters:
      algorithm - the asymmetric algorithm
      keySize - the size of the key in bits, which will be checked against the requirements specified for the given algorithm. For RSA and DSA, the minimum is 2048 bits. For EC, only specific sizes such as 256 (P-256), 384 (P-384), or 521 (P-521) bits are allowed. If the key size does not satisfy the constraints for the selected algorithm, an exception will be thrown.
      Throws:
      InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if the key size does not satisfy the constraints for the selected algorithm

    • deriveSecretKeyWithRandomSalt

      public static SecretKey deriveSecretKeyWithRandomSalt(SymmetricAlgorithm algorithm, byte[] input, byte @Nullable [] info, InputBufferHandling inputBufferHandling)
      Derives a secret key for the specified symmetric algorithm using a randomly generated salt.
      Parameters:
      algorithm - the symmetric algorithm for which the key is to be derived
      input - the input data used for key derivation
      info - optional context-specific information used in the key derivation process
      inputBufferHandling - the handling mechanism for input buffers during key derivation
      Returns:
      the derived secret key

    • deriveSecretKey

      public static SecretKey deriveSecretKey(SymmetricAlgorithm algorithm, byte[] salt, byte[] input, byte @Nullable [] info, InputBufferHandling inputBufferHandling)
      Derives a cryptographic key using the specified symmetric algorithm, salt, input data, and additional info. The method utilizes the HKDF (HMAC-based Extract-and-Expand Key Derivation Function) with SHA-256 to securely derive a key.
      Parameters:
      algorithm - the symmetric algorithm for which the key is being derived; it determines the key size and the key algorithm (e.g., AES)
      salt - a non-secret random value used to ensure uniqueness of derived keys; must be at least 16 bytes
      input - the input keying material (IKM) used as a source of entropy for key derivation
      info - optional context and application-specific information used for domain separation during key derivation
      inputBufferHandling - the handling mechanism for input buffers during key derivation
      Returns:
      a SecretKey instance containing the derived key that is compatible with the specified algorithm
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided salt is shorter than 16 bytes

    • loadPublicKeyFromPem

      public static PublicKey loadPublicKeyFromPem(String pem) throws InvalidKeySpecException, NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Loads a public key from a PEM formatted string.
      Parameters:
      pem - the PEM formatted string containing the public key.
      Returns:
      the PublicKey object representing the loaded public key.
      Throws:
      InvalidKeySpecException - if the specified key specification is invalid.
      NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the algorithm is not available in the environment

    • loadPrivateKeyFromPem

      public static PrivateKey loadPrivateKeyFromPem(String pem) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException, InvalidKeySpecException
      Loads a private key from a PEM-formatted PKCS#8 string. Supports multiple algorithms (RSA, EC, DSA) by attempting to parse with each.
      Parameters:
      pem - the PEM-formatted private key string, including the header and footer
      Returns:
      the PrivateKey object reconstructed from the provided PEM string
      Throws:
      InvalidKeySpecException - if the provided PEM content cannot be converted to a valid private key
      NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the algorithm is not available in the environment

    • toPem

      public static String toPem(Key key)
      Converts the given cryptographic key to its PEM (Privacy-Enhanced Mail) format.
      Parameters:
      key - the cryptographic key to be converted into PEM format
      Returns:
      the PEM-encoded string representation of the key
      Throws:
      UncheckedIOException - if an unexpected I/O exception occurs

    • appendPem

      public static void appendPem(Key key, Appendable app) throws IOException
      Appends a PEM (Privacy Enhanced Mail) format representation of the specified cryptographic key to the provided Appendable.

      The method determines the key type (private or public), extracts its binary encoding, converts it to a Base64-encoded string, and wraps it in the appropriate PEM format with headers and footers.

      Parameters:
      key - the cryptographic key to be formatted into PEM; must be either a PrivateKey or PublicKey.
      app - the target Appendable to which the PEM representation will be appended.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing to the Appendable.
      IllegalStateException - if the key type is not supported.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided key cannot be encoded.

    • parseDer

      public static Key parseDer(byte[] bytes) throws GeneralSecurityException, IOException
      Parses a DER-encoded key and returns the corresponding key object, either a public or private key, based on the provided byte array.
      Parameters:
      bytes - the byte array containing the DER-encoded key
      Returns:
      the parsed key object, either a PublicKey or PrivateKey
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if there is an issue with generating the key (e.g., unsupported algorithm)
      IOException - if the byte array cannot be parsed as a valid ASN.1 structure

    • toDer

      public static byte[] toDer(Key key) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Converts a given Key to its encoded form using DER (Distinguished Encoding Rules). Supports X.509 encoding for public keys, PKCS#8 encoding for private keys, and raw byte encoding for symmetric keys.
      Parameters:
      key - the key to be converted to DER encoding. This can be an instance of PublicKey, PrivateKey, or SecretKey.
      Returns:
      the DER-encoded byte array representation of the specified key.
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if the key type is unsupported or an encoding error occurs.
